content.raw:
oh that’s from the ign-gui PR: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/241/add-support-for-visualizing-int-16-bit/diff#Lsrc/plugins/ImageDisplay.ccT283](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/241/add-support-for-visualizing-int-16-bit/diff#Lsrc/plugins/ImageDisplay.ccT283)

The temperature of the objects remains the same though, it’s just the visualizaton. The thermal camera tool I played with also has very similar visualization effect. Here’s an example: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?time\_continue=5&v=\_1SyhwYu33s&feature=emb\_logo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=5&v=_1SyhwYu33s&feature=emb_logo)

As the camera pans to the right \(13s\), the color of the hills in the background changes to yellow, and then changes back to purple as it pans back. 

‌
content.html:
oh that’s from the ign-gui PR: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/241/add-support-for-visualizing-int-16-bit/diff#Lsrc/plugins/ImageDisplay.ccT283

The temperature of the objects remains the same though, it’s just the visualizaton. The thermal camera tool I played with also has very similar visualization effect. Here’s an example: https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=5&v=_1SyhwYu33s&feature=emb_logo

As the camera pans to the right (13s), the color of the hills in the background changes to yellow, and then changes back to purple as it pans back.

‌
